topic: How to combine keyword with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine keyword with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining Keyword and Type Hinting in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates how to effectively use keyword-based type hints to write more readable, maintainable, and efficient production code in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the benefits of using type hints for better code readability, maintainability, and type safety
Learn the new keyword-based type hinting system introduced in Python 3.12
Discover how to use built-in annotations like TypedDict, Protocol, Literal, and Final
Explore examples of using keyword-based type hints for functions, classes, and modules
caveats: It's important to note that while keyword-based type hints are more concise and readable, some third-party libraries may not support all of the new features yet.
Ensure your code is properly formatted and adheres to PEP 586 for maximum compatibility.
